required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Cycling Environments for Persons With Parkinson Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Virtual Cycling Environments (VCYCLE) Increases Exercise Intensity of Persons With Parkinson Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: This study asks three questions about Persons with Parkinson Disease that use a bicycle for exercise. 1. Does the use of virtual reality increase the intensity and and enjoyment of the experience compared to bicycling without virtual reality? 2. Does the way in which the bicycling (interval compared to continous) is performed affect the experience? 3. How does the way the virtual reality is delivered (with goggles or projected on a screen) affect the experience?

detailed_description.textblock: Participants attend two sessions. They complete movement assessments and questionnaires about physical activity. During the first session they bicycle in a semi-immersive (projected on a screen) and an immersive (with googles) virtual environment. After each bout they completed a questionnaire about the experience. In the second session they bicycle four times with and without a virtual environment using both a continous and interval mode. Their oxygen consumption is measured during cycling. They complete questionnaires after each exercise bout.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in two sessions: Session 1(day 1 for 2 hours) collected continuously during 2 exercise bouts to compare exercise bouts.____Session 2 (day 2 for 2 hours) collected continuously in four exercise bouts to compare exercise bouts

primary_outcome.measure: Physiological Responses to Exercise- Oxygen Consumption
primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in two sessions: Session 1(day 1 for 2 hours) collected continuously during 2 exercise bouts to compare exercise bouts___ Session 2 (day 2 for 2 hours) collected continuously in four exercise bouts to compare exercise bouts
primary_outcome.description: Metabolic equivalents derived from oxygen consumption which is collected continuously during four exercise bouts.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in two sessions: Session 1 collected continuously during 2 exercise bouts in a 2 hour Session 2: in four exercise bouts in a 2 hour session to compare exercise bouts
primary_outcome.description: Intrinsic Motivation Inventory Enjoyment sub-scales collected at the end of each exercise bout

primary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in two sessions: Session 1 collected continuously during 2 exercise bouts in a 2 hour Session 2: in four exercise bouts in a 2 hour session to compare exercise bouts
primary_outcome.description: Collected continuously during exercise bouts and will be evaluated as a % of age adjusted maximum heart rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Borg Scale for Rate of perceived exertion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in both Day 1 and 2 (each day is two hours) as follows: Day 1 (4 times in each of the two cycling bouts) Day 2 (6 times each of the four cycling bouts)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-Report of Effort collected at a multiple time points to compare with exercise bouts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in Day 1 (2 hour session) twice to compare before and after scores
secondary_outcome.description: 16 item questionnaire about feelings or symptoms of cyber sickness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in once in day 1 and once in day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of Bicycling Conditions relative to each other (and audio recording of experience)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collected in once in day 1 and once in day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of Bicycling Conditions relative to each other (and audio recording of experience)

other_outcome.description: Description of Motor Performance Scored from 0-108 a lower score is better outcome

other_outcome.measure: Physical Activity Scale for the Elderly

other_outcome.description: 15 item inventory to rate depression (scored from 0-15 with a lower score being better)

arm_group.description: This is a single arm study in which all participants will execute the same tasks over two sessions.

intervention.intervention_name: Bicycling with and without virtual reality
intervention.description: In one session: Exercise intensity and enjoyment are measured while participants bicycle in a virtual compared to non-virtual environment. Cycling takes places in two modes continous and interval. In a second session exercise intensity and enjoyment are compared during bicycling with virtual reality presented in two different ways.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis of Parkinson's disease
2. Hoehn and Yahr stages II-III,
3. 45-75 years old
4. able to ride a stationary upright bicycle
5. able to sign informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have a recent history of severe heart disease, severe lung disease, uncontrolled diabetes, traumatic brain injury or neurological disorder other than Parkinson Disease.
2. Are unable to follow directions or sign a consent form
3. Do not have adequate vision or hearing ability to see or hear a television
4. Have unstable medical condition or musculoskeletal disorder such as severe arthritis, recent knee surgery, hip surgery, or any other condition that the investigators determine would impair the ability to ride the bicycle
5. Have any other medical condition that prevents bicycling
6. Have moderate depression

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

patient_data.ipd_description: Immediately following completion of our proposed study we will submit a de-identified data set of our protocol and links to published papers.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: We will make study data available immediately following completion.
